  1. import json
  3. from abc import ABCMeta, abstractmethod
  4. from django.core.mail import EmailMultiAlternatives
  5. from django.template.loader import render_to_string
  7. from ftp_deploy.conf import *
  8. from .core import commits_parser
  9. from .curl import curl_connection
  12. class notification():
  14. """Notification abstract class, take three arguments, host, service object and payload json string"""
  15. __metaclass__ = ABCMeta
  17. def __init__(self, host, service, payload):
  18. self.host = host
  19. self.service = service
  20. self.payload = json.loads(payload)
  21. self.commits = self.payload['commits']
  22. self.user = self.payload['user']
  23. self.from_email = 'noreply@ftpdeploy.com'
  24. self.send()
  26. @property
  27. def template_html(self):
  28. raise NotImplementedError
  30. @property
  31. def template_text(self):
  32. raise NotImplementedError
  34. @abstractmethod
  35. def subject(self):
  36. pass
  38. @abstractmethod
  39. def emails(self):
  40. pass
  42. @abstractmethod
  43. def context(self):
  44. pass
  46. def deploy_user(self):
  47. """Method return email of deploy user"""
  48. if self.payload['user'] == 'Restore':
  49. return []
  51. try:
  52. curl = curl_connection(BITBUCKET_SETTINGS['username'], BITBUCKET_SETTINGS['password'])
  53. curl.authenticate()
  54. url = 'https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/users/%s/emails' % self.payload['user']
  55. context = json.loads(curl.perform(url))
  56. return [context[0]['email']]
  57. except Exception, e:
  58. return []
  60. def send(self):
  61. """Sent method process emails from list returned by emails() method"""
  63. for recipient in self.emails():
  64. text_content = render_to_string(self.template_text, self.context())
  65. html_content = render_to_string(self.template_html, self.context())
  67. msg = EmailMultiAlternatives(self.subject(), text_content, self.from_email, [recipient])
  68. msg.attach_alternative(html_content, "text/html")
  69. msg.send()
  72. class notification_success(notification):
  74. """Notification class for success"""
  76. template_html = 'ftp_deploy/email/email_success.html'
  77. template_text = 'ftp_deploy/email/email_success.txt'
  79. def subject(self):
  80. return '%s - Deploy Successfully' % self.service
  82. def emails(self):
  83. emails_list = list()
  84. notifications = self.service.notification
  86. if notifications:
  87. emails_list += notifications.get_success()
  89. if notifications.deploy_user_success():
  90. emails_list += self.deploy_user()
  92. if notifications.commit_user_success():
  93. emails_list += commits_parser(self.commits).email_list()
  95. return list(set(emails_list))
  97. def context(self):
  98. context = dict()
  99. context['service'] = self.service
  100. context['host'] = self.host
  101. context['commits_info'] = commits_parser(self.commits).commits_info()
  102. context['files_added'], context['files_modified'], context['files_removed'] = commits_parser(self.commits).file_diff()
  103. return context
  106. class notification_fail(notification):
  108. """Notification class for fail"""
  110. template_html = 'ftp_deploy/email/email_fail.html'
  111. template_text = 'ftp_deploy/email/email_fail.txt'
  113. def __init__(self, host, service, payload, error):
  114. self.error = error
  115. super(notification_fail, self).__init__(host, service, payload)
  117. def subject(self):
  118. return '%s - Deploy Fail' % self.service
  120. def emails(self):
  121. emails_list = list()
  122. notifications = self.service.notification
  124. if notifications:
  126. emails_list += notifications.get_fail()
  128. if notifications.deploy_user_fail():
  129. emails_list += self.deploy_user()
  131. if notifications.commit_user_fail():
  132. emails_list += commits_parser(self.commits).email_list()
  134. return list(set(emails_list))
  136. def context(self):
  137. context = dict()
  138. context['host'] = self.host
  139. context['service'] = self.service
  140. context['error'] = self.error
  141. return context
